image.altText: A man in a pale shirt is held by a serious-looking police officer.

props.synopsis: Notorious outback killer Bradley John Murdoch dies in palliative care at Alice Springs Hospital, taking key information to his grave about his murder of Peter Falconio.

title.children: Convicted killer Bradley Murdoch dies 24 years after Peter Falconio's murder

image.altText: A graphic of three women in black and white with a purple background.

props.synopsis: Facing the highest rates of domestic and family violence in Australia, experts in the Northern Territory's DV sector have identified five ways the NT can become a safer place for women and children.

title.children: Five changes domestic violence experts say could make NT women safer

image.altText: PMC watch house interior 2

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's police union is warning a death or serious incident in custody is only a matter of time under dangerous conditions in police watch houses.

title.children: Police union raises alarm over 'out of control' watch house conditions

image.altText: Dark green leaves in foreground focus, with blurred outline of a olive-tanned woman in the background, green singlet, brown hair

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's family and domestic violence sector is at a "crisis point" with one service turning away up to 200 women every month, including those assessed as being at "serious risk" of harm or death.

title.children: Hundreds of women turned away from shelter in territory's DV crisis

image.altText: A red chopper sitting on a remote airstrip.

props.synopsis: A telecommunications worker has been confirmed as the victim of a "fatal helicopter incident", after the chopper he was travelling in collided with a bird in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Telstra worker confirmed as man killed after helicopter strikes bird

image.altText: A drone shot of a port facility alongside the ocean.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese meets Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on the third full day of the Australian prime minister's China trip.

title.children: Darwin Port ownership not raised in PM's meeting with Xi Jinping

image.altText: A woman reads a book to children.

props.synopsis: A University of Sydney-led paper undertook Australia's first peer-targeted study of unpaid work for childcare workers, amid a crisis of confidence across the sector.

title.children: Childcare workers struggling to care for children over 'non-contact' tasks

image.altText: A side-by-side image shows young German woman Carolina Wilga and Aboriginal man Clinton Lockyer

props.synopsis: The miraculous survival of German backpacker Carolina Wilga in the West Australian outback was met with joy and relief across the country. But for families of missing Aboriginal men who are still searching for answers, it's prompted uncomfortable questions.

title.children: Why do we care about some people who go missing in the bush, but ignore others?

image.altText: A green matcha latte in a black mug with rosetta latte art.

props.synopsis: From traditional tea ceremonies to viral TikToks, the rising popularity of matcha is driving a global shortage, leaving farmers, suppliers and cafes trying to keep up.

title.children: Tea farmers 'cannot cope' as matcha demand surges

image.altText: Donald Trump and Gianni Infantino in blue suits peering over the golden FIFA Club World Cup trophy on the Oval Office desk

props.synopsis: Despite FIFA's claims the Club World Cup was "a world-class stage", it faced significant challenges that could also impact the 2026 World Cup in a country governed by the uncertainty of Donald Trump.

title.children: Empty seats and big delays mean World Cup issues will trouble Trump's America

image.altText: US President Donald Trump points while speaking to reporters

props.synopsis: The US president announces the agreement on his social media platform but provides no further details on the deal.

title.children: Trump says trade deal with Indonesia 'great deal, for everybody'

image.altText: Adam Scott and Britt Lower side-by-side in a scene in Severance.

props.synopsis: Other shows nominated include The White Lotus and The Bear. See the full list of nominees.

title.children: Severance receives 27 Emmy nods as nominations list revealed

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Treasury's mistaken release of advice that "tax should be raised" looks like a happy accident for a treasurer determined for major reform.

title.children: A happy accident? Tax reform talk heats up after Treasury's FOI error

image.altText: ASX boards

props.synopsis: The local share market pulls back after hitting fresh records, and the fastest rise in US inflation since January hits Wall Street stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops as Trump tariff worries rattle markets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Global views on China rise as tariffs dent US: Pew
ASX slumps on US inflation fears as miners dumped

image.altText: court drawing, man sits in federal court as he faces murder charges, he is sat next to his attorney

props.synopsis: A decision on whether to seek the death penalty "will not come for several months" and will be up to US Attorney-General Pam Bondi.

title.children: New evidence revealed in Minnesota politician and her husband's murder

image.altText: a man in a hat standing in front of a tree

props.synopsis: A group of Australia's top environmental scientists calls for changes to prescribed burning after government documents confirm hundreds of trees in an ecological hotspot have been destroyed by a government-lit fire.

title.children: Top scientists sound alarm over damage caused by prescribed burns

image.altText: a flooded subway station in New York, water shooting up from the ground

props.synopsis: Two people are killed as their vehicle is swept up in floodwaters in New Jersey while in New York, the rains flood the subway system.

title.children: Two dead after heavy storm leaves New York subway system flooded

image.altText: Li Qiang and Anthony Albanese walk down a red carpet in front of ceremonial guards holding guns.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese meets with China's Premier Li Qiang, who takes a thinly veiled swipe at Donald Trump's tariff policies while calling for greater economic ties between Australia and China.

title.children: China takes veiled swipe at Trump's tariffs amid calls for greater ties with Australia

image.altText: Masked men holding machine guns in the back of a military ute.

props.synopsis: Deadly sectarian clashes in Syria have left dozens dead and threatened the survival of the country's fragile post-war order.

title.children: After the downfall of a regime, here's why Israel is striking Syria

image.altText: The back of a policeman facing the felled tree with tape that says police line do not cross

props.synopsis: The two men were jailed for four years and three months for felling the tree — estimated to be almost 200 years old.

title.children: Duo behind 'senseless' felling of UK's historic Sycamore Gap tree jailed

image.altText: A close up of a man's hands placed together in front of his body in a worried pose.

props.synopsis: Experts say Australia is reaching a "tipping point" as mental health insurance claims surge, raising criticisms that super funds and insurers may be dragging out payouts for people with a mental illness.

title.children: 'Unprecedented spike': Insurers under pressure as mental health claims soar

image.altText: Camp site with police tape surrounding

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man known to the child has been charged with manslaughter over the death of a seven-month-old baby boy who was pulled from a lake by his mother at a park outside Gympie over the weekend.

title.children: Man charged with manslaughter over death of baby pulled from lake

image.altText: The back of a man wearing a black hoodie in the foreground with the wave breaking in the background

props.synopsis: For so long a mere dream for its advocates and board riders, an artificial reef on WA's south coast is delivering near-perfect waves.

title.children: 'High-performance' artificial reef transforms town's surf scene

image.altText: Mark Latham sat down wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: New South Wales MP Mark Latham denies the allegations of abuse, made by his former partner, as "comically false and ridiculous".

title.children: Mark Latham denies ex-partner's allegations of domestic abuse and 'degrading' sex acts

image.altText: Photo illustration exterior view of Terraces by Carter Williamson for NSW pattern book

props.synopsis: These housing designs are focused on densifying the suburbs and fast-tracking low-rise housing throughout Sydney and beyond.

title.children: For just $1 a design, expect to see these homes pop up across Sydney

image.altText: Woman sits in a chair in a psychologist's office as they show her something on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A number of states have indicated they will soon allow GPs to diagnose ADHD, but doctors warn patients may still face out-of-pocket costs or have difficulty accessing prescriptions.

title.children: GPs set to diagnose ADHD, but say appointments unlikely to be bulk-billed

image.altText: A Roman mosaic depicting a pair of lovers of different skin tones

props.synopsis: A Roman-era mosaic panel stolen by a Nazi German captain during World War II is returned to Pompeii.

title.children: Roman-era mosaic stolen by Nazis returns to Pompeii

image.altText: A ginger-haired, bearded man in a basketball uniform dribbles the ball up the court.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old will complete his extraordinary return to professional basketball for reigning champions the Illawarra Hawks in the city where he almost lost his life.

title.children: Basketballer almost killed in one-punch attack returns to NBL

image.altText: A man pours red wine into a glass on a table set with cutlery and a napkins.

props.synopsis: Australia crushed more red wine grapes this year but fewer people are drinking it, prompting warnings of a worsening wine glut.

title.children: Australia's red wine glut likely to get worse

image.altText: A woman with dark wavy hair in the backyard of a house.

props.synopsis: At 42, Amna did not want to join a share house or spend all her money on rent. She turned to house-sitting to save a deposit.

title.children: How I avoided paying rent for 18 months to save for a house deposit

image.altText: Paul Gallen and Sonny Bill Williams composite

props.synopsis: Paul Gallen and Sonny Bill Williams will meet in the boxing ring on Wednesday night in a fight devoid of meaning, if that even matters at all.

title.children: Gallen vs Williams is an unedifying prospect, but does that matter?

image.altText: A close up of a man with a white moustache and an yellow pagari

props.synopsis: Indian-born runner Fauja Singh was believed to be the oldest man to run a full marathon in 2011 at the age of 100 in Toronto.

title.children: Fauja Singh, world's 'oldest marathon runner', dies at 114 in hit-and-run

image.altText: West Indies batter Mikyle Louis completes his swing as the cricket ball hits his stumps.

props.synopsis: Former West Indies captain Carl Hooper calls for heads to roll and World Cup hero Carlos Brathwaite labels the team "abysmal" after the team's record 3-0 loss to Australia.

title.children: Abysmal, unfair, angry and upset: Aussies leave West Indies cricket in tatters
